Description: Fragment from a ring-shaped pottery sanctuary lamp with many nozzles: traces of three wick-holes. White wash and traces of red-brown paint on nozzles. Fine light red fabric with very fine mica and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Several lamps of this imported Ephesus type of lamp were found in the Temenos of Aphrodite (Gardner 1888, 48; British Museum GR 1888,0601.151.a-c; 1888, 0601.151.d-e; 1888,0601.151.f; 1888,0601.151.g; 1965,0930.884-885). Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 143), the Sanctuary of Hemithea at Kastabos (Cook and Plommer 1966, 55-6, pl. 9) and the Sanctuary of Demeter, Knossos (Coldstream 1973, pls 13, 15 and 26). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton. Cook, J. M. and Plommer, W. H. 1966. The Sanctuary of Hemithea at Kastabos, Cambridge. Coldstream, J. N. 1973. Knossos, the Sanctuary of Demeter, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KA.19) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5900 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
